title: Thermodynamic favorability POCl3 at two temps

content.description:
At <math alttext="398 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>398</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> the reaction shown has a <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>H</mi><mtext>°</mtext></math> of <math alttext="negative 543 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mn>543</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math> and a <math alttext="delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>S</mi><mo>°</mo></math> of <math alttext="negative 178 joules per kelvin mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>178</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo>·</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>. The reaction is run at both <math alttext="398 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>398</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>K</mtext></math> and <math alttext="798 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>798</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>K</mtext></math>.

<math alttext="2 P C l 3, gas, plus O 2, gas, react to produce 2 P O C l 3, gas " overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> <mo> </mo> <msub> <mi>PCl</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>→</mo> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mn>2</mn> <mo> </mo> <msub> <mi>POCl</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>
content.question: Which of the following correctly identifies the thermodynamic favorability for the reaction at the two temperatures? (Assume that <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <mi>H</mi> <mtext>°</mtext> </math> and <math alttext="delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>S</mi><mtext>°</mtext></math> do not change with temperature.)

choices.label:
At <math alttext="398 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>398</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math>
 At <math alttext="798 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>798</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math>

Unfavorable
   Favorable

topic.text: 9.3: Gibbs Free Energy and Thermodynamic Favorability

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
